description: Youths attacked a village in eastern South Sudan and shot dead at least 12 people while 15 children are missing, officials said on Tuesday, as local conflicts continued to increase ahead of elections late this year.
title: At least 12 killed, 15 children missing in South Sudan attack

description: The United States warned Iran on Tuesday not to retaliate against it for an attack on Iran's embassy compound in Syria, telling the U.N. Security Council it had no prior warning of the strike that Tehran has blamed on Washington's ally Israel.
title: At UN, US warns Iran not to target it over Syria strike

description: Australia on Wednesday told Israel that the death of an Australian aid worker in Gaza by an Israeli air strike was outrageous, and said Israel would continue to lose support unless it changed its course of action.
title: Australia outraged by death of aid worker in Israeli air strike

description: Australia's foreign ministry said on Tuesday it was seeking to confirm reports that one of its citizens died in a suspected Israeli airstrike in Gaza.
title: Australia says it is trying to confirm death of citizen in Gaza

description: Belarus started military exercises on Tuesday in regions bordering Ukraine and European Union members Lithuania and Poland, the Belarusian defence ministry said.
title: Belarus holds military drills near borders with EU, Ukraine

description: Pope Francis found an ally in his predecessor Benedict XVI when he spoke in favour of civil partnerships for same-sex couples, the pontiff said in a new book due out in Spain.
title: Benedict backed me up on rights for LGBT couples, Pope Francis says

description: U.S. President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping held their first direct talks on Tuesday since meeting in November, with Biden looking to keep tensions from mounting ahead of Taiwan's presidential inauguration in May.
title: Biden speaks to China's Xi on Taiwan, Ukraine, Philippines

description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken will hold talks in Paris on Tuesday after a Washington-based NGO was struck by an Israeli airstrike in central Gaza, adding pressure on the United States to toughen its stance in the war between Israel and Hamas.
title: Blinken in Paris after Gaza NGO attack, French U.N. push

description: Brazil is advocating for the immunity of heads of states that are not party to treaties such as the International Criminal Court (ICC), according to a document seen by Reuters, which could favor Russian President Vladimir Putin attending the Group of 20 summit in Rio this year.
title: Brazil view on immunity for heads of state could favor Putin at G20 summit

description: China's commerce ministry said on Tuesday it firmly opposes a United States' report on foreign trade barriers, which it said "listed China as a country of primary concern".
title: China opposes US trade barriers report listing it as 'primary concern'

description: Fifteen of China's major steel bar producers have unanimously called on authorities for measures to restrict steel bar output to support prices, the China Iron and Steel Industry Association said on Tuesday.
title: China steel bar producers call for authorities to restrict output amid price slump

description: Cyprus expressed deep concern on Tuesday over a spike in the number of largely Syrian irregular immigrants it said were coming from neighbouring Lebanon after more than 350 such arrivals were recorded in two days.
title: Cyprus concerned over spike in Syrian irregular migration from Lebanon

description: Cyprus's president on Tuesday urged an immediate investigation into the killing of seven aid workers in an Israeli airstrike in Gaza, saying the U.S.-based charity they were members of was a "crucial partner" in efforts to get aid to the enclave by sea.
title: Cyprus president says Cyprus to Gaza corridor will continue to operate

description: Israel's destruction of Gaza's biggest hospital in a raid over the past two weeks has ripped the heart out of the enclave's healthcare system, the World Health Organization said on Tuesday.
title: Destruction of Gaza's Shifa Hospital rips heart out of health system, WHO says

description: Egyptian President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi has been criticised as a despot for crushing opposition lingering from a brief period of democracy, while winning praise from supporters for boosting security and driving an army-led infrastructure binge.
title: Egypt's Sisi: Authoritarian leader with penchant for bridges

description: Egyptian President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi was sworn in for his third term on Tuesday in the country's new capital, the largest of the mega-projects that have signified his rule while stretching the country's finances.
title: Egypt's Sisi sworn in for third term

description: Eight people died when a car carrying them swerved off a road and fell into a river in southern Albania early on Tuesday, police said.
title: Eight die after car falls into river in Albania, police say

description: The Palestinian Authority on Tuesday formally asked for renewed consideration by the United Nations Security Council of its 2011 application to become a full member of the world body.
title: Explainer: Could the Palestinians become a full United Nations member?

description: Senegal's once jailed opposition candidate Bassirou Diomaye Faye was sworn in on Tuesday as the West African nation's fifth and youngest president ever, promising to restore stability and bring economic progress.
title: Faye sworn in as Senegal president, cites 'profound desire for change'

description: Teachers shut classroom doors to protect their pupils after a shooting incident at a school in the Helsinki suburb of Vantaa on Tuesday morning, pupils and parents said.
title: Finnish school kept children safe in classrooms after shooting

description: Fifteen people were killed and eight others were injured in a fire at a nightclub in central Istanbul during daytime repair work, the city mayor Ekrem Imamoglu said on Tuesday.
title: Fire at Istanbul nightclub kills 15 people, mayor says

description: After Silvio Berlusconi's death last June, senior figures in his Forza Italia party openly speculated that the group would not be able to survive without its charismatic leader at the helm.
title: Forza Italia defies doom-mongers to outlive Berlusconi

description: France will propose at an EU-wide level sanctions on Russian companies spreading 'disinformation', said French Foreign Affairs Minister Stephane Sejourne on Tuesday.
title: France to propose sanctions at EU level on Russian firms spreading disinformation

description: His clinic destroyed during Israel's bombardment of the Gaza Strip, Palestinian dentist Najdat Saqr has retrieved equipment from the ruins and set up a tent to treat patients again.
title: Gaza dentist sets up tent to replace destroyed clinic

description: The Gaza Strip suffered about $18.5 billion in damages to critical infrastructure in the first four months of the Israeli bombardment launched in response to the Oct. 7 Hamas attacks, according to a joint World Bank and the United Nations report released on Tuesday.
title: Gaza infrastructure damages estimated at $18.5 bln in UN-World Bank report

description: German Finance Minister Christian Lindner sees scope for up to 9 billion euros ($9.7 billion) in additional defence spending from 2028 if the country can reduce its debt levels, he said in comments to the DPA news agency published on Tuesday.
title: Germany could spend up to 9 bln euros more on defence from 2028, minister says

description: Germany will support Ukraine with 180,000 rounds of artillery shells as a contribution to a Czech-led plan to buy ammunition for Ukraine, with a price tag of 576 million euros ($618 million), the defence ministry said.
title: Germany to support Ukraine with 180,000 artillery shells via Czech initiative

description: One child was killed and two seriously wounded in a shooting at a school outside the Finnish capital on April 2, police said. A 12-year-old fellow pupil suspected of the attack has been taken into custody.
title: Gun violence and regulation in Finland

description: Ukraine's top prosecutor said on Tuesday that Russian crimes across occupied Ukrainian territories, including the Bucha massacres, show a pattern of genocidal behaviour that should be tried domestically and ultimately by the International Criminal Court.
title: 'Hallmarks of genocide' in Russian crimes across Ukraine, Ukrainian prosecutor says

description: Peru has had six presidents since 2018 and current head of state Dina Boluarte in political hot water and facing calls to step down amid questions about the provenance of her collection of Rolex watches.
title: How Rolexes put Peru's presidency at risk

description: The International Monetary Fund concluded its visit to Ethiopia to discuss a request for IMF support on Tuesday without reaching an agreement, leaving the East African nation short of a commitment it made with its official international creditors.
title: IMF ends Ethiopia visit, deal not yet secured

description: Omar Deeb was nearly hit by Israeli tank fire while searching for food in Gaza, and then saw people killed around him when he set out once more to feed his family in the beseiged enclave.
title: In Gaza, Palestinians risk death in desperate rush for aid

description: India rejected China's renaming of about 30 places in its northeastern Himalayan state of Arunachal Pradesh on Tuesday, calling the move "senseless" and reaffirming that the border province is an "integral" part of India.
title: India rejects China's renaming of 30 places in Himalayan border state

description: Peru's attorney general said on Tuesday that an investigation into President Dina Boluarte has been widened to include a $56,000 Cartier bracelet in her possession and 1.1 million soles ($298,070.67) in bank deposits of "unknown origin."
title: Investigation into Peru's Boluarte widened to include Cartier bracelet, bank deposits

description: Iran will retaliate for a suspected Israeli air strike against its consulate in the Syrian capital Damascus, Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi said on Tuesday, a day after seven Iranian military commanders were killed in the attack.
title: Iran says it will retaliate for Israel's attack on its Damascus consulate

description: Irish Enterprise Minister Simon Coveney said on Tuesday he would not serve in the next cabinet, clearing the way for Simon Harris to make a wider reshuffle of his Fine Gael team of ministers when he is confirmed as prime minister next week.
title: Ireland's Coveney not seeking post in next PM Harris' cabinet

description: An explosion woke Luis Har in the middle of the night and he rolled off his mattress seeking cover. This was it, he thought, expecting the building where he was being held captive to collapse.
title: Israeli hostage, 71, still stunned by reality of rescue

description: Italy's co-ruling League party on Tuesday disavowed an accord struck in 2017 with United Russia, the governing party behind President Vladimir Putin, as League leader Matteo Salvini faces mounting pressure over his historic ties to the Kremlin.
title: Italy's League disavows accord with Russia's ruling party

description: Japan will lift its suspension of funding to the U.N. Palestinian refugee agency (UNRWA), Foreign Minister Yoko Kamikawa told local media on Tuesday.
title: Japan lifts funding suspension to Palestinian refugee agency UNRWA

description: Celebrity chef Jose Andres' disdain for red tape is one of the reasons why his food charity found itself coordinating the humanitarian effort in Gaza when seven of its workers were killed in an Israeli airstrike.
title: Jose Andres, the celebrity chef sidestepping bureaucracy to bring aid to Gaza

description: The Kremlin said on Tuesday that a suspected Israeli air strike against the Iranian consulate in Damascus was an act of aggression, and called on Israel to cease such "absolutely unacceptable" actions.
title: Kremlin says Israeli attack on Iranian consulate is 'act of aggression'

description: The Kremlin said on Tuesday that a visit by Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro to Russia was being prepared, a sign of continued close ties between the two major oil-producing nations which are both at odds with the United States.
title: Kremlin says visit by Venezuela's Maduro is in works

description: Kyrgyz President Sadyr Japarov on Tuesday signed into law a bill tightening state control over foreign-funded non-governmental organisations (NGOs), which human rights bodies and groups have criticised as restrictive.
title: Kyrgyzstan adopts law targeting foreign-funded NGOs

description: U.S. Navy veteran Louis Conter, the last surviving crew member from the battleship USS Arizona, which was destroyed by Japanese warplanes in the attack on Pearl Harbor more than eight decades ago, has died at age 102.
title: Last USS Arizona survivor of Pearl Harbor attack dies at 102

description: Malaysian police are looking into reports that an armed man detained in the country's capital last week had links to an Israeli crime syndicate, its top official said on Tuesday, amid a widening probe.
title: Malaysia probes links between detained man and Israeli crime group

description: Guadeloupe-born author Maryse Conde, who wrote about colonialism, slavery and the French-Caribbean diaspora, died in southern France at the age of 90.
title: Maryse Conde, Caribbean chronicler of colonialism, dies at 90

description: A ruling party mayoral candidate was shot dead on Monday in central Mexico during an event on the first day of her campaign, despite having requested security protection from authorities and receiving no response.
title: Mayoral candidate murdered in Mexico amid rising political violence

description: NATO boss Jens Stoltenberg has proposed a 100 billion euro ($107 billion), five-year package of military aid to Ukraine that would give the Western alliance a more direct role in providing support to Kyiv, five diplomats said on Tuesday.
title: NATO boss floats 100 billion euro military aid fund for Ukraine

description: North Korea said on Wednesday it successfully test-fired a new mid- to long-range solid-fuel hypersonic missile, North Korean newspaper Rodong Sinmun said.
title: North Korea says it test-fired new solid-fuel hypersonic missile

description: More than 53,000 people fled Haiti's capital in just three weeks of March as conflict between powerful armed gangs wreaked havoc for civilians, with the state largely absent and a path out of the chaos yet to be established by politicians.
title: Over 50,000 fled Haiti capital in three weeks, with politicians in deadlock

description: The Philippines on Tuesday said its national security adviser and his U.S. counterpart have discussed China's "coercive, aggressive, and deceptive actions" in the South China Sea.
title: Philippines, U.S. top security officials discuss China's 'coercive, aggressive' actions, Manila says

description: Poland's foreign minister asked the Israeli ambassador in Warsaw for "urgent explanations" after a Polish volunteer was killed while providing aid in Gaza.
title: Poland asks Israel for explanation after aid worker killed in Gaza

description: Poland's Supreme Audit Office (NIK) notified prosecutors that former Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki may have committed a crime by acting to the detriment of the public interest when granting subsidies to municipalities, it said on Monday.
title: Polish audit office notifies prosecutors former PM may have abused power

description: Portugal's centre-right minority government of Prime Minister Luis Montenegro will take office later on Tuesday amid doubts it can survive beyond this year as it faces the most fragmented parliament in 50 years of democracy.
title: Portugal's minority government to be sworn in, stability doubtful

description: Turkey's pro-Kurdish DEM Party called on Tuesday for authorities to reverse a block on one of its mayors taking office after local elections, and said it was challenging other results over what it called "illegal voters" that prevented it winning.
title: Pro-Kurdish party challenges election outcomes in eastern Turkey

description: President Vladimir Putin said on Tuesday that Russia will find out who was behind last month's attack on a concert hall near Moscow that killed at least 144 people.
title: Putin says Russia will find out who ordered deadly concert shooting

description: To hear Hartmut Issmer tell it, Germany's recent history is one of decline from the 1970s to 2015, when then-Chancellor Angela Merkel let the migrants in.
title: Rich and retired: the boom beneficiaries who finance Germany's far right

description: Russia has appointed Admiral Alexander Moiseev as head of the navy, the defence ministry said on Tuesday.
title: Russia appoints Admiral Moiseev as chief of the navy

description: Russian drones targeted energy infrastructure in overnight attacks on Ukraine's central Dnipropetrovsk and Kirovohrad regions, hitting an energy facility in the latter, Ukraine's military said on Tuesday.
title: Russia damages energy facility in drone attacks on central Ukraine, Kyiv says

description: Russian air defence units downed four Ukrainian drones late on Tuesday over the border region of Kursk and one more over the adjacent Belgorod region, the Russian Defence Ministry said on Telegram.
title: Russia downs Ukrainian drones over Kursk and Belgorod

description: Russia said on Tuesday it had important matters to discuss with Afghanistan's Taliban leaders and was working to remove the Taliban from its list of banned terrorist organisations.
title: Russia says it is working on removing Taliban from its terrorist list

description: A Moscow court sentenced in absentia Pytor Verzilov, a Russian-Canadian activist and independent news site founder, to eight years and four months for social media posts criticising the war in Ukraine, Russian media reported on Tuesday.
title: Russia sentences Pussy Riot activist to eight years for Ukraine 'war fakes'

description: Russia's richest people added $72 billion to their fortunes over the past year, taking their collective wealth to $577 billion, Forbes said on Tuesday, with Vagit Alekperov, former president of oil major Lukoil , taking Russia's top spot.
title: Russian billionaires see collective wealth near $600 bln - Forbes

description: A Russian missile attack on Tuesday damaged an educational facility in Ukraine's city of Dnipro and injured five people, local authorities said.
title: Russian missile damages educational facility in Ukraine's Dnipro, governor says

description: Recovery teams opened a second channel enabling smaller vessels to navigate the Port of Baltimore on Tuesday but most commercial shipping remains blocked by the collapsed bridge and stranded container ship that brought the structure down a week ago.
title: Second channel opens around collapsed Baltimore bridge, but not for shipping

description: Drones attacked industrial sites in Russia's Tatarstan, Russian news agencies reported on Tuesday, citing local authorities.
title: Several people injured in drone attack on industrial sites in Russia's Tatarstan - agencies

description: Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu said on Tuesday that the army was pushing Ukrainian forces westwards.
title: Shoigu says Russia is pushing Ukrainian forces westwards

description: A Singapore court on Tuesday convicted the first defendant in its biggest-ever money laundering case, local media reported, in one of the city-state's highest-profile crime probes over which more than $2.2 billion of assets has been seized or frozen.
title: Singapore convicts first suspect in $2.2 billion money laundering case, media reports

description: Six primary-school students were killed and 14 others were injured when a refrigerator truck veered into a group of children in the southern Iraqi city of Basra on Tuesday, the Interior Ministry said in a statement.
title: Six children dead, 14 injured in Iraq road accident

description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol showed the first signs of flexibility in his medical reform plan as a prolonged standoff with doctors is ramping up pressure ahead of next week's parliamentary elections which are expected to be close.
title: South Korea's Yoon hints at flexibility in doctors' strike as election looms

description: Spain will recognise Palestinian statehood by July, Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez told journalists during a Middle East tour, according to several reports published on Tuesday in Spanish media.
title: Spain to recognise Palestinian statehood by July, leader says -reports

description: Israel must clarify the circumstances surrounding the deaths of seven people working for Spanish-American celebrity chef Jose Andres' World Central Kitchen in an Israeli airstrike in central Gaza, Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said on Tuesday.
title: Spain's PM urges Israel to clarify circumstances of airstrike on aid workers

description: Sudan on Tuesday suspended the work of Saudi state-owned broadcasters Al Arabiya, Al Hadath and UAE-owned Sky News Arabia channel "due to its lack of commitment to the required professionalism and transparency and failure to renew its licenses", Sudanese state news agency (SUNA) said.
title: Sudan suspends work of Al Arabiya, Al Hadath and Sky News Arabia channels, state news agency says

description: Thai LGBT activists celebrated another victory on Tuesday after a marriage equality bill overwhelmingly passed a first reading in the upper house, a key step bringing the country closer to becoming Asia's third territory to legalise same-sex unions.
title: Thai LGBT activists celebrate vote that brings marriage equality closer

description: Three children were injured in a shooting at a primary school in Finland early on Tuesday, and a suspect, who was also a minor, was later apprehended, Finnish police said.
title: Three children injured in Finland primary school shooting

description: A top official in Russia's Security Council said the United States was imposing economic obligations on its NATO partners and setting conditions for buying specific weapons and equipment.
title: Top Russian official says US dictates NATO spending

description: The Port of Baltimore opened a temporary channel on Monday, freeing some tugs and barges that had been trapped by last week's bridge collapse, but officials said wider restoration of commercial shipping remained frustrated by unyielding conditions.
title: Trapped vessels start moving out of Baltimore after bridge collapse

description: The United Arab Emirates is pausing humanitarian aid efforts through a maritime corridor from Cyprus to Gaza pending further safety guarantees from Israel and a full investigation into the deaths of aid workers in Gaza, a UAE official told Reuters on Tuesday.
title: UAE pauses aid to Gaza by sea after Israeli strike kills aid workers

description: Uganda's constitutional court is due on Wednesday to deliver a verdict on a petition seeking to annul the country's tough Anti-Homosexuality Act (AHA), a lawyer for the petitioners said on Tuesday.
title: Ugandan court to issue verdict in petition against tough anti-gay law

description: The British government said J.K. Rowling should not be arrested for her transgender views after the Harry Potter author challenged Scotland's new hate crime law with social media posts asserting that a number of trans women were men.
title: UK government backs J.K. Rowling in Scottish hate crime law challenge

description: British police on Tuesday said three suspects believed to be involved in the stabbing of a journalist working for a Persian language media organisation in London last week left the country within hours of the attack.
title: UK police say suspects left country hours after stabbing Iranian journalist

description: Britain on Tuesday summoned the Israeli ambassador over the deaths of aid workers in Gaza, the foreign ministry said.
title: UK summons Israeli ambassador over death of aid workers

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy has signed a bill to cut the mobilisation age for combat duty to 25 from 27, the parliament's website showed.
title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy signs bill lowering mobilisation age for combat duty to 25

description: Sometimes Ukrainian lawyer Khrystyna Vrashchuk shudders when she thinks about the work she does.
title: Ukrainian defence attorneys face moral dilemma in war crime trials

description: British foreign minister David Cameron said on Tuesday that news of aid workers, including a British national, being killed by an Israeli airstrike in Gaza was "deeply distressing" and called on Israel to investigate and provide an explanation.
title: UK's Cameron calls on Israel to investigate 'deeply distressing' death of aid workers

description: Haiti is witnessing an unprecedented level of human rights abuses amid a state of chaos caused by gang violence, the United Nations human rights chief said on Tuesday.
title: UN rights chief deplores 'unprecedented scale' of rights abuses in Haiti

description: The killing of seven people working for celebrity chef Jose Andres' World Central Kitchen charity in Gaza is "the inevitable result of the way this war is currently being conducted," United Nations spokesperson Stephane Dujarric said on Tuesday.
title: UN to Israel: let aid workers do their job

description: Reported discrimination and attacks against Muslims and Palestinians reached a record high in the U.S. in 2023, driven by rising Islamophobia and bias as the Israel-Gaza war raged late in the year, data from an advocacy group showed on Tuesday.
title: US anti-Muslim incidents hit record high in 2023 due to Israel-Gaza war

description: The U.S. told Iran that it "had no involvement" or advanced knowledge of an Israeli strike on a diplomatic compound in Syria, Axios reported on Monday citing a U.S. official.
title: US tells Iran it 'had no involvement' in Israel strike, Axios reports

description: The United States did not have advance knowledge of what Iran says was an Israeli air strike on its embassy compound in Damascus that killed two of its generals and five military advisers, according to two U.S. officials.
title: US was not alerted about strike on Iran's Damascus mission - US officials

description: At least five employees of NGO World Central Kitchen (WCK) were killed in an Israeli airstrike on Gaza, the Hamas-run Gaza government media office said late on Monday.
title: What is World Central Kitchen, the NGO whose workers were killed in Gaza?

description: The White House will hold a scaled-down iftar dinner on Tuesday to celebrate Islam's holy month of Ramadan, after some invitees turned the president down over frustrations in the Muslim community over his policy toward the Israel-Gaza war.
title: White House hosts muted Ramadan event as Biden's Israel policy draws anger

description: The White House said on Tuesday it was "outraged" by an Israeli airstrike in Gaza that killed seven people working for World Central Kitchen (WCK), and that President Joe Biden called the charity aid group's founder to share his condolences.
title: White House 'outraged' by Israeli airstrike that killed aid workers in Gaza

description: White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan plans to travel to Saudi Arabia this week for talks with Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman amid a U.S. push for progress toward normalizing relations between Israel and Saudi Arabia.
title: White House's Sullivan traveling to Saudi Arabia for talks with MBS
